frameDefinitions: These words describe the size of message that a Speaker is judged by a (usually unexpressed)
A Cognizer would engage in an Activity if asked or otherwise prompted to do so.
An Entity is judged by a sound Attribute of some perceived level of Volume intensity.

A Manner describes general or specific characteristics of an event in one of three ways:  First, it can refer to how a Comparison_event transpires, absent the influence of an entity (e.g. 'the way you talk').
An Importer receives Goods from an Exporting_area, across a boundary or border to a different area, the Importing_area.
This frame contains transparent nouns (and some adjectives) denoting quantities of a Mass or of Individuals.
frameExamples: Graham is very shy with most people, but he gets very <t>chatty</t> with Mr. Roberts.
The court is <t>willing</t> to depart from the usual range of sentencing .
He completed the task in a fervent <t>manner</t>.
The U.S. <t>imported</t> some wheat in the period, although it exported about ten times as much.
He found them in the <t>deluge</t> of papers on his desk.
listRoleDefinitions: This is the person who is characterized as talkative, reticent etc.  It is usually the External Argument:

<fen>Text</fen> is rarely expressed because the quantity of information given is the focus of the frame, rather than the information content. Texts can occur as NP objects, but cannot be either direct quotes or complement clauses.
This role is the <fen>Topic</fen> on which much or little information is communicated. <fen>Topic</fen> is far more frequent than Message in this frame.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the individual that is willing to engage in the <fen>Activity</fen>.
The <fen>Activity</fen> is what the <fen>Cognizer</fen> would do under certain circumstances.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is willing to engage in the <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is willing to engage in the <fen>Activity</fen>.
The <fen>Entity</fen> for which the sound level <fen>Attribute</fen> is under consideration.
The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is under consideration. This role is incorporated in each LU in the frame.
A quantity or characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen>'s sound output with repspect to its <fen>Attribute</fen>.
A modifier expressing the deviation of the <fen>Volume</fen> from the norm.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular <fen>Volume</fen> for the <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The place where an <fen>Entity</fen> is located.

The <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is the principal event being characteriszed by the <fen>Manner</fen>. The <fen>Manner</fen> of this <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is often used in comparison with the <fen>Foreground_event</fen>.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> that is associated with or directly responsible for the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen>.
The description of the <fen>Comparison_event</fen> or <fen>Comparison_activity</fen>.
A description of the <fen>Manner</fen>.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> conducts or engages in the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen> that is being described.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that brings the <fen>Goods</fen> into the <fen>Importing_area</fen>.
The items of value whose location is changing.
The role <fen>Importing_area</fen> is the place that the <fen>Goods</fen> end up as a result of motion.
The place where the <fen>Goods</fen> are initially, before the being moved.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Importer</fen> moves the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The <fen>Quantity</fen>-denoting <t>Target</t> word.
A substance that is being quantified.
A collection of entities.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Pat</fex> has been silent on this issue.
Kim is very talkative <fex>about her family and childhood</fex>.
<fex>My mom</fex> is very loath to take any drugs without medical supervision.
Does biology really matter more than a willingness <fex>to take an active role in a child's life</fex>?
A modicum <fex>of seepage on the floor</fex> is to be expected.
A number <fex>of concerned citizens</fex> have raised objections.
